chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M. Lyman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes: If revoked, defendant entitled to 93 days credit, subject to verification of the jail.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with either victim, W.E.H. or L.L.P., or either of their residences;
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Any/all counseling as deemed necessary/appropriate by DOC;
Submission of DNA sample to the Iowa County Sheriff's Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M. Lyman

records.addlTxt: 3:33 PM Defendant Christopher M. Lyman in court, in custody.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Christopher M. Lyman. State recites joint recommendation:  Ct 1: dismissed but read-in.  Ct 2:  WSP 3.5 yrs:  18 mo  initial, 24 mo extended, imposed/stayed; 3 yrs probation:  no contact with W.E.H. or L.L.P. or their residences; no use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription; AODA and follow through; counseling as recommended by DOC; $518 + $20 cps; DNA submission.  If revoked, 93 days sentence credit, subject to jail verification.   Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Defendant sworn by the Clerk. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation. Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.

11:46 AM Defendant Christopher M. Lyman appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Andrew J. Burdick for Christopher M. Lyman appeared in court, Attorney Curtis E Johnson for State of Wisconsin appeared in court.  Victim makes statement.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently waives right to preliminary hearing.  Information filed.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Waiver of formal reading of the information.  Defendant stands mute - not guilty plea entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:04 PM Defendant Christopher M. Lyman appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared in court for Christopher M. Lyman, Attorney Curtis E Johnson appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.   Victim present via phone and makes statement.  Request for waiver of prelim hearing. No objection to conducting next hearing via zoom from ICSO.  DAs office to make arrangements for zoom appearance.  Atty Burdick may appear via zoom as well.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Waiver of Prelim on March 15, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on March 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:13 PM Defendant Christopher M. Lyman in court with attorney Andrew J. Burdick, both via zoom.  Defendant Christopher M. Lyman in custody.  Curtis E Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim present via phone and makes statement.  Atty Burdick makes request for bond modification and to schedule further status.  Atty Burdick makes request for $1500 cash bond converted to signature bond and gives basis.  State makes objection to modification.  Court denies motion for bond modification.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
